Package library

Class DistributedSnapshot<StateType,​MessageType>

java.lang.Object
library.DistributedSnapshot<StateType,​MessageType>
Type Parameters:
StateType - this is the type that will be used to store the application state
MessageType - this is the type that will be exchanged as a message between nodes
public class DistributedSnapshot<StateType,​MessageType>
extends java.lang.Object
This is the main class of the distributed snapshot library. A DistributedSnapshot object must be created in order to interact with the library. This implementation provides methods such as init, sendMessage, updateState, addConnection, removeConnection and initiateSnapshot.

  • Method Details

    • init

      public void init​(java.lang.String yourHostname, int rmiRegistryPort, AppConnector<MessageType,​StateType> appConnector) throws java.rmi.RemoteException, java.rmi.AlreadyBoundException, AlreadyInitialized
      This method is used to initialize a DistributedSnapshot object. It sets the hostname, the port and the appConnector reference. It starts the rmi registry and publishes the RemoteInterface in order to be reachable from other nodes.
      Parameters:
      yourHostname - the hostname the application can be reached at
      rmiRegistryPort - the port used by the rmi registry
      appConnector - the reference to an appConnector implementation
      Throws:
      java.rmi.RemoteException - communication-related exception that may occur during remote calls
      java.rmi.AlreadyBoundException - the rmi registry has already bound a remote interface, try with another registry
      AlreadyInitialized - this instance has been already initialized

    • joinNetwork

      public java.util.ArrayList<Entity> joinNetwork​(java.lang.String hostname, int port) throws java.rmi.RemoteException, java.rmi.NotBoundException, NotInitialized, OperationForbidden
      This method is used to join the mesh network provided a gateway node to access it. It populates the remoteImplementation.remoteNodes with the nodes of the network and their remoteInterfaces
      Parameters:
      hostname - the hostname of one node in the network (will be our initial gateway)
      port - the port of our initial gateway to the network
      Returns:
      an ArrayList of Entity (a class containing hostname and port) of all the nodes in the network
      Throws:
      java.rmi.RemoteException - communication-related exception that may occur during remote calls
      java.rmi.NotBoundException - thrown if an attempt is made to lookup or unbind in the registry a name that has no associated binding.
      NotInitialized - thrown if an attempt to join the network is made before calling the init method of the library
      OperationForbidden - thrown if an attempt to join the network is made through the node itself

    • sendMessage

      public void sendMessage​(java.lang.String hostname, int port, MessageType message) throws RemoteNodeNotFound, java.rmi.RemoteException, java.rmi.NotBoundException, NotInitialized, SnapshotInterruptException, RestoreInProgress, OperationForbidden
      This method is used to send a message to a specific node by using rmi
      Parameters:
      hostname - the hostname of the remote node
      port - the port associated to the rmi registry in the remote node
      message - the message to send to the remote node
      Throws:
      RemoteNodeNotFound - the remote node is not found, you must first connect to it
      java.rmi.RemoteException - communication-related exception that may occur during remote calls
      java.rmi.NotBoundException - the remote node has not bound its remote implementation
      NotInitialized - this instance hasn't been initialized, you must do it first
      SnapshotInterruptException - it's not possible to remove a node when a snapshot is running
      RestoreInProgress - thrown if a restore of a snapshot is in progress and the user tries to send a message
      OperationForbidden - thrown if an attempt to send a message to the node itself is made

    • updateState

      public void updateState​(StateType state) throws StateUpdateException, RestoreInProgress, NotInitialized
      This method is used to update the state. It makes a deep copy to store inside the remoteImplementation
      Parameters:
      state - the object to save
      Throws:
      StateUpdateException - something went wrong making a deep copy
      RestoreInProgress - thrown if a restore of a snapshot is in progress and the user tries to update the state of the node
      NotInitialized - thrown if an attempt to update the state is made before the node is correctly initialized

    • initiateSnapshot

      public void initiateSnapshot() throws java.io.IOException, DoubleMarkerException, UnexpectedMarkerReceived, NotInitialized, RestoreInProgress
      This method is used to start a snapshot with the distributed snapshot algorithm
      Throws:
      java.rmi.RemoteException - communication-related exception that may occur during remote calls
      DoubleMarkerException - received multiple marker (same id) from the same link
      UnexpectedMarkerReceived - the sender node is not present in the remote nodes list
      NotInitialized - this instance hasn't been initialized, you must do it first
      RestoreInProgress - thrown when trying to start a snapshot while a restore is in progress in this node
      java.io.IOException

    • disconnect

      public void disconnect() throws OperationForbidden, SnapshotInterruptException, NotInitialized, RestoreInProgress
      This is method is used to disconnect from the mesh network. It does so by invoking removeMe on all connected nodes.
      Throws:
      SnapshotInterruptException - it's not possible to remove a node when a snapshot is running
      NotInitialized - this instance hasn't been initialized, you must do it first
      OperationForbidden - it is not possible to remove a connection while a snapshot is running
      RestoreInProgress - thrown if an attempt to disconnect this node from the network is made while a restore is in progress

    • stop

      public void stop() throws java.rmi.NotBoundException, java.rmi.RemoteException
      This method is used to un-export and unbind this remoteImplementation in the RMI registry
      Throws:
      java.rmi.RemoteException - communication-related exception that may occur during remote calls
      java.rmi.NotBoundException - thrown if an attempt is made to lookup or unbind in the registry a name that has no associated binding.

    • restoreLastSnapshot

      public void restoreLastSnapshot() throws RestoreAlreadyInProgress, java.io.IOException, java.rmi.NotBoundException, RestoreInProgress, RestoreNotPossible, java.lang.ClassNotFoundException, OperationForbidden
      This method is used to start restoring from the most recent snapshot available. The node must be initialized before calling this method.
      Throws:
      RestoreAlreadyInProgress - thrown when asking a remote node to restore while another restore is already in progress on the remote node
      java.rmi.RemoteException - communication-related exception that may occur during remote calls
      java.rmi.NotBoundException - thrown if an attempt is made to lookup or unbind in the registry a name that has no associated binding.
      RestoreInProgress - thrown if we are trying to restore while a restore is already in progress in our node
      RestoreNotPossible - thrown if the restore was not possible, reason specified in the exception message (for example a node is no more reachable)
      java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - thrown when the storage facility is not able to reconstruct the Snapshot from the file
      java.io.IOException
      OperationForbidden

    • removeNode

      public void removeNode​(java.lang.String hostname, int port) throws java.rmi.RemoteException, RestoreInProgress, NotInitialized, SnapshotInterruptException
      Remove the specified node from the network by telling everyone to do so
      Parameters:
      hostname - the hostname of the node to remove
      port - the port of the node to remove
      Throws:
      java.rmi.RemoteException - communication-related exception that may occur during remote calls
      RestoreInProgress - thrown when trying to remove a node while a snapshot restore is in progress
      NotInitialized - thrown if an attempt to ask to remove a node is made before this node is correctly initialized
      SnapshotInterruptException - thrown if an attempt to remove a node (change in the network topology) is made while a snapshot is running
